BOCEPREVIR

  • Pregnancy

  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Chronic hepatitis C infection of genotype 1 in patients with compensated liver disease (in combination with ribavirin and peginterferon alfa),

By mouth

  • For adults
    800 mg 3 times a day, for duration of treatment consult product literature.

Dose adjustments due to interactions

Appendix 1 (boceprevir).

Caution with concomitant use of other drugs known to prolong QT interval.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid.

Contra indications

  • Autoimmune hepatitis

Known side effects

notKnown: Rash with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (in combination with ribavirin and peginterferon alfa), Stevens-Johnson syndrome (in combination with ribavirin and peginterferon alfa),

Advice for patients and carers

If a dose is more than 6 hours late, the missed dose should not be taken and the next dose should be taken at the normal time.

National funding/access decisions

NICE TA253

Boceprevir for chronic hepatitis C infection of genotype 1 (April 2012)

Boceprevir in combination with ribavirin and peginterferon alfa is an option for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C infection of genotype 1 in adults with compensated liver disease:

  • who have not been treated previously;
  • in whom previous treatment (e.g. with peginterferon alfa in combination with ribavirin) has failed.
www.nice.org.uk/TA253 www.nice.org.uk/TA253

Cautions regarding administration

  • Coagulopathy
  • hypoalbuminaemia
  • low platelets
  • predisposition to QT interval prolongation

  • Not recommended in patients with low platelets, hypoalbuminaemia, or coagulopathy—if initiated in these patients monitor closely for signs of infection, worsening liver impairment and anaemia (increased risk of severe morbidity and mortality).

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor full blood count before starting treatment and then on weeks 2, 4, 8, and 12 of treatment, then as indicated clinically.

Prepared medicinal forms of BOCEPREVIR

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
